sen.j: 平 良兼（たいら の よしかね）は、平安時代中期の武将。
sen.e: TAIRA no Yoshikane was a warlord who lived during the mid-Heian period.
TAIRA no Yoshikane was a warlord who lived during the mid-Heian period.
TAIRA no Yoshikane was a warlord who lived during the mid-Heian period.

sen.j: 平高望の次男。
sen.e: He was the second son of TAIRA no Takamochi.
He was the second son of TAIRA no Takamochi.
He was the second son of TAIRA no Takamochi.

sen.j: 寛平元年5月13日 (旧暦)（889年6月14日）、宇多天皇の勅命により平姓を賜与され臣籍降下した。
sen.e: On June 14, 889, he was given the family name of Taira and demoted from nobility to subject by the order of Emperor Uda.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On June 14, 889, he was given the family name of Taira and demoted from nobility to subject on orders of Emperor Uda.
On June 18, 889, he was given the family name of Taira and demoted from nobility to subject on orders of Emperor Uda.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 昌泰元年（898年）に上総国介に任じられた父の高望とともに上総国に下向、武射郡の屋形を本拠とした。
sen.e: Since his father Takamochi was appointed as the Assistant governor of Kazusa Province in 898, he went down to Kazusa Province with his father, where they were based in the house in Musha District.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Since his father Takamochi was appointed as the Assistant governor of Kazusa Province in 898, he went down to Kazusa Province with his father, where they were based in a house inside the Musha District.

Since his father Takamochi was appointed as Kazusa no kuni no suke (the Assistant governor of Kazusa Province) in 898, he went down to Kazusa Province with his father, where they were based in a house inside the Musha District.
sen.cmt: 上総国介 を追加しました。

sen.j: 父高望の上総介の任期が過ぎても帰京せず父に次いで上総介を勤めるなどし、上総下総国に勢力を拡大。
sen.e: Even after his father's term of the Assistant governor of Kazusa Province was expired, he did not return to Kyoto but succeeded to the Assistance governor of Kazusa Province after his father, thereby extending power in Kazusa Province and Shimousa Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Even after his father's term as Assistant governor of Kazusa Province expired, he did not return to Kyoto but succeeded to the Assistant governor of Kazusa Province after his father, thereby extending power in Kazusa and Shimousa Provinces.

Even after his father's term as Kazusa no kuni no suke expired, he did not return to Kyoto but succeeded to Kazusa no kuni no suke after his father, thereby extending power in Kazusa and Shimosa Provinces.
sen.cmt: 上総国介 を追加しました。

sen.j: その後各地に広がる高望王流桓武平氏の基盤を固めた。
sen.e: The foundation of the Kanmu-Heishi (Taira clan) of the Prince Takamochi line was strengthened and its power expanded to other regions accordingly.

sen.j: 甥であり聟でもある平将門とはかねてから不仲であり、兄の平国香が、将門と舅の源護の息子らの抗争に巻き込まれ死亡した際には不介入であった。
sen.e: Yoshikane was on bad terms with his nephew and the son-in-law, TAIRA no Masakado, and stayed out of the conflict between Masakado and the son of his father-in-law MINAMOTO no Mamoru, in which his elder brother TAIRA no Kunika was killed.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

Yoshikane was on bad terms with his nephew and the son-in-law, TAIRA no Masakado, and stayed out of the conflict between Masakado and the son of his father-in-law MINAMOTO no Mamoru, in which his elder brother TAIRA no Kunika was killed.

sen.j: しかし将門にとっては伯父にあたる平良正をも打ち破るに至って武力介入し、将門との対立の中心に立つようになる。
sen.e: However, Yoshikane militarily intervened the conflict only after Masakado defeated his uncle TAIRA no Yoshimasa, thereby acting as a leader of the conflict with Masakado.

sen.j: 父国香を死に追い込んだ将門との和平路線を取る甥の平貞盛を批判・説得して味方に引き入れ、下野国を目指し出陣した。
sen.e: He criticized and persuaded his nephew TAIRA no Sadamori, who was taking a peace approach to Masakado who killed Kunika (Sadamori's father), so as to get him on his side, going into a battle in Shimotsuke Province.

He criticized and persuaded his nephew TAIRA no Sadamori, who was taking a peaceful approach to Masakado who had killed Kunika (Sadamori's father), to get him on his side when going into battle in Shimotsuke Province.

He criticized and persuaded his nephew TAIRA no Sadamori, who was taking a peaceful approach to Masakado who had killed Kunika (Sadamori's father), to get him on his side when going into battle in Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 承平 (日本)6年（936年）6月、良正・貞盛と共に下野国境にて将門と合戦になった。
sen.e: In June 936 (old calendar), with Yoshimasa and Sadamori, he battled against Masakado on the boundary of Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In June 936 (old calendar), with Yoshimasa and Sadamori, he battled against Masakado at the boundary of Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 数では圧倒的に勝るも敗れ、下野国府に退却。
sen.e: Although they outnumbered the enemy, they were defeated and returned to the provincial capital of Shimotsuke Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Although they outnumbered the enemy, they were defeated and returned to the provincial capital of Shimotsuke Province.
Although they outnumbered the enemy, they were defeated and returned to the provincial capital of Shimotsuke Province.

sen.j: 国府は包囲されるも、将門は包囲の一角を解きあえて良兼を逃した。
sen.e: Although Masakado surrounded the provincial capital, he lifted a siege and allowed Yoshikane to get away.
Although Masakado surrounded the provincial capital, he lifted the siege and allowed Yoshikane to escape.
Although Masakado surrounded the provincial capital, he lifted the siege and allowed Yoshikane to escape.

sen.j: その後源護の告状よって、将門は京都に召喚され裁きを受ける事となる。
sen.e: After that, Masakado was summoned to Kyoto by the complaint of MINAMOTO no Mamoru and was judged.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After that, Masakado was summoned to Kyoto because of a complaint made by MINAMOTO no Mamoru to be judged.
After that, Masakado was summoned to Kyoto because of a complaint made by MINAMOTO no Mamoru to be judged.

sen.j: しかし、承平7年（937年）4月、朱雀天皇元服の大赦で罪を許され5月に帰国。
sen.e: In April 937 (old calendar), however, he was permitted under an amnesty of Emperor Suzaku on the celebration of his attainment of manhood, and returned to his country in May.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In April 937 (old calendar), however, he was permitted after given amnesty by Emperor Suzaku on the celebration of his attainment of manhood, and he returned to his home in May.

sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: すると同年8月6日、良兼は将門の父「良将」や「高望王」など父祖の霊像を掲げて将門の常羽御厩を攻め、今度は将門を敗走させて常羽御厩を焼き討ちした。
sen.e: On September 18, 937, Yoshikane attacked Ikuha no mimaya, Masakado's territory, raising images of his paternal ancestors including "Yoshimasa" (Masakado's father) and "Prince Takamochi," and defeated Masakado to make him flee this time, attacking and burning Ikuha no mimaya.
sen.cmt: 承平7年8月6日は西暦937年9月18日に変換して訳しました。

sen.j: すぐさま兵を再編した将門に反撃されるも再びそれを退けた。
sen.e: Soon after that, Masakado realigned the army to make a counterattack, but was defeated again.

sen.e: Soon after that, Masakado regrouped the army to counterattack, but was defeated again.

sen.j: その際、密告のもと将門の妻子（つまり良兼の娘と孫）を捕らえ当時の婚姻形態は通い婚でもあり、上総に連れ帰る。
sen.e: On this occasion, Yoshikane captured Masakado's wife and daughter (i.e., Yoshikane's daughter and granddaughter) under secret information and took them back to Kazusa; the form of marriage in those days was commuting relationships.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: On this occasion, Yoshikane captured Masakado's wife and daughter (i.e., Yoshikane's daughter and granddaughter) and secretly took them back to Kazusa; the form of marriage in those days involved commuting relationships.

sen.j: だが、息子の平公雅や平公連が手助けして9月10日に再び出奔し将門の元に戻ってしまう。
sen.e: However, his sons TAIRA no Kinmasa and TAIRA no Kintsura helped them to vanish again on October 21, 937, so they went back to Masakado's place.
sen.cmt: 承平7年9月10日は西暦937年10月21日に変換して訳しました。

sen.j: その後も将門との争いが続くなか、11月5日将門の訴えに応えた朝廷により武蔵国・安房国・上総国・常陸国・下野国などの国々に良兼ら追捕の官符が下ってしまう。
sen.e: In the continued conflict with Masakado, on December 15, 937 upon complaint of Masakado, the Imperial Court issued official documents to Musashi Province, Awa Province, Kazusa Province, Hitachi Province, Shimotsuke Province and so on, ordering to pursue and capture Yoshikane and others.
sen.cmt: 承平7年9月10日は西暦937年12月15日に変換して訳しました。
sen.e: In the continued conflict with Masakado, on December 15, 937 after receiving the complaint from Masakado, the Imperial Court issued official documents to Musashi Province, Awa Province, Kazusa Province, Hitachi Province, Shimotsuke Province, and so on, ordering to pursue and capture Yoshikane and others.

sen.j: これにより将門と良兼は公的に立場が逆転し将門は力を得て勢い付いた。
sen.e: As a result, the stands of Masakado and Yoshikane in public were reversed, and Masakado gained an increased power.

sen.j: しかし、各地の国司は官符を受けても平一族と争うことを躊躇して動くこともなく、また官符が出された国々の実質統治者は平一族当人らである為に、何の効果もなかったと思われる。
sen.e: Even with the official documents, however, the provincial governors hesitated to battle against the Taira family: in fact, as the substantial governors in the provinces that received the official documents were from the Taira family, the official documents did not produce any effect.

sen.j: 良兼は12月14日将門の駈使である丈部子春丸を買収して岩井市の営所の内情を探り夜襲をかけるも察知され逆襲を受け敗走。
sen.e: On January 22, 938, Yoshikane bought off HASETSUKABE no Koharumaru who was a crier served Masakado, to get inside information of the camp in Iwai City and made a night attack, but he was perceived and counterattacked to rout.

sen.j: これ以降良兼の勢力は衰退し、天慶2年（939年）6月に病死した。
sen.e: Thereafter, Yoshikane lost his power and died of disease in June 939 (old calendar).
